DOC.brief_summary: This research trial study patient early-stage vulvar cancer undergo sentinel lymph node dissection . Sentinel lymph node dissection may fewer side effect remove lymph node . Observing patient undergoing sentinel lymph node dissection may help doctor confirm safety procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Observation Patients With Early-Stage Vulvar Cancer Undergoing Sentinel Lymph Node Dissection
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To prospectively observe patient receive radiation +/- chemotherapy immediately lymph node dissection confirm safety procedure . OUTLINE : Patients receive standard therapy include sentinel lymph node dissection . Patients observe collect information treatment outcomes every 2 month 2 year .
DOC.criteria: Patients must squamous cell carcinoma depth invasion > 1 mm Patients must T1 T2 tumor ( International Federation Gynecology Obstetrics [ FIGO ] stag ) , < 4 cm , encroach urethra , vagina , anus clinically negative inguinofemoral lymph node Localization size tumor perilesional injection tracer three four site possible Preoperative imaging show enlarge ( < 1.5 cm ) suspicious nodes Patients must sign informed consent Inoperable tumor diameter > 4 cm Patients inguinofemoral lymph node , palpation clinically suspect metastasis , radiology enlarge ( > 1.5 cm ) suspicious groin node cytologically proven inguinofemoral lymph node metastases Patients multifocal tumor Patients currently investigational drug treatment vulvar cancer exclude participation trial
